column1: '''Holman Greenhand''' was a Hobbit of [[the Shire]], noted for being a fine gardener.
Holman's grandfather and namesake, [[Holman the greenhanded]], initiated both the family name and the family profession: gardening.<ref name="Gamgee">{{App
column2: Gamgee}}</ref> Holman became a gardener in [[Hobbiton]], and one of the gardens he tended was that of [[Bag End]]. Around {{TA
column3: 2941}}, he took on his distant cousin [[Gaffer Gamgee
column4: Hamfast Gamgee]] as an apprentice.<ref name="Party">{{FR

column1: One morning of that spring, [[Gandalf]] visited Bag End, but found its master, [[Bilbo Baggins]], not at home. Holman informed him that Bilbo had gone on one of his walks, as it was the [[Elves]]' [[Yestare
column2: new year]]. Holman's description of Bilbo convinced Gandalf he had found the perfect man for his mission, to re-take [[Lonely Mountain

column1: When Bilbo went missing - that is, on his mission - Holman and Hamfast had their hands full in making sure the garden wasn't trampled as the place was swarming with Hobbits, hoping to get a piece of the Baggins estate.<ref name="Party"/>
Gaffer took over the job around {{TA
column3: Party}}: "[Gaffer Gamgee] had tended the garden at Bag End for forty years"</ref> about which time Holman retired or died.

column1: Holman means "hole-man", and is distinct from the real-life English surname<ref name="Nomen">{{HM
column2: N}}, p. 760</ref> which contains ''holm'' "river island" rather than ''hol'' "hole".<ref>[[Jim Allan]] (ed.), ''[[An Introduction to Elvish]]'', "Giving of Names"</ref>

column1: :Holman lives in a hut on the other side of [[the Water]].
